summary: This document is an email chain from December 2018 discussing a meeting to talk about lawmakers calling on the DOJ to explain the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) given to Jeffrey Epstein. The emails show coordination to schedule a call or meeting on the topic.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The email chain is about lawmakers demanding a probe into the 'sweetheart deal' or Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) given to Epstein.

events.title: Discussion of Epstein NPA probe
events.description: Email exchange about scheduling a meeting or call to discuss lawmakers calling on the DOJ to explain the Non-Prosecution Agreement given to Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: The email chain is from December 6-7, 2018.
The subject is lawmakers calling for the DOJ to explain the 'sweetheart deal' or Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) given to Jeffrey Epstein.
The participants are coordinating to schedule a meeting or call (suggested for 11:00 AM) to discuss the matter.
The email references a specific NBC News article about lawmakers demanding a probe.
The document shows ongoing political and legal scrutiny of the Epstein NPA years after its issuance.
